channel.title: Arab Revolution – Baraza
channel.description: Critical Collaboration on the Middle East, South Asia, and Africa

item.title: Game-Changer: The Rise and Expansion of the Global University
item.dc:creator: Bradley Williams
item.description: There is a de facto 21st century gold rush among elite universities in the United States. In the age of globalized capital, privatization of the state, and commodified education, top-ranked, private universities and colleges are expanding beyond U.S. borders and building proxy campuses in locations fundamental to American economic and military interests. Of the U.S. … Continue reading Game-Changer: The Rise and Expansion of the Global University →

item.title: Watch the Throne: The Moroccan Monarchy’s Mic Check
item.dc:creator: Chantal James
item.description: This July Morocco celebrated Throne Day, in celebration of King Mohammed VI’s ascension to the throne thirteen years ago. He seems to have much to celebrate; time and again, the crown asserts itself as secure against threats large and small. What has been the Moroccan monarchy’s secret to maintaining power in a post-Bouazizi world, when … Continue reading Watch the Throne: The Moroccan Monarchy’s Mic Check →

item.title: Liberation Square
item.dc:creator: Thalia Beaty
item.description: Ashraf Khalil’s Liberation Square offers a gritty and engrossing account of the events that took place in Egypt in 2011, using the voices of both Egypt’s most prominent political observers and the activists who risked everything in pursuit of an ever-elusive dream. Khalil, who has covered regional politics from Cairo, Jerusalem, and Iraq for a variety of … Continue reading Liberation Square →

item.title: Global Unrest Ushers in New Crises of Representation: Assessing the Present and Future of Area Studies
item.dc:creator: barazaonline
item.description: The global wave of protests presently underway has ushered in a new crisis in the interdisciplinary field of area studies. The Arab Spring in particular has sounded an alarming wake-up call, leading many to challenge the relevance of modalities and methods currently employed within area studies. There is an existentialist quality underpinning this crisis, as … Continue reading Global Unrest Ushers in New Crises of Representation: Assessing the Present and Future of Area Studies →

item.title: Politics of Labeling and Marginalization: Deconstructing Islamic Feminist Discourse
item.dc:creator: Chantal James
item.description: According to Foucault, the production of discourse in every society is simultaneously controlled, organized, selected and redistributed according to particular procedures. These procedures are meant to “avert its [the discourse’s] power and its dangers, to cope with change events, and to evade its ponderous and awesome materiality.”I Islamic feminist discourse is no different. Just like any … Continue reading Politics of Labeling and Marginalization: Deconstructing Islamic Feminist Discourse →
